pages.title: Color Mixing
pages.text: By using the basic colours $(c_cyan)Cyan$(), $(c_magenta)Magenta$() and $(c_yellow)Yellow$() (almost) any colour can be created.

Your attempts to mix $(l:general/gemstone_powder)Gemstone Powder$(/l) directly have not been very successful. But now you have another idea:$(br)The closeness of your gemstones to nature suggests that $(italic)nature$() must be both the source and the answer!$(br2)You quickly scribble some notes, result being $(l:general/coloured_trees)a recipe$(), which looks very promising.

pages.title: Brown Pigment?
pages.text: You have tried and tried, to no avail. You could not find a way to create $(c_brown)brown$() by mixing your gem powder. The closest you came was a washed-out orange - ugh.$(br)It can't be that hard. Like... $(c_brown)Dirt is brown$() and it's the most common stuff around.$(br2)There must be a way... $(br)and you're pretty sure $(c_black)Black$() is the answer.
$(br2)$(br2)$(br2)$(br)$(italic)Seriously, look it up! The way we perceive brown is fascinating!$()
